title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. The White House said it will nominate Caroline Kennedy as ambassador -- to which country?

A. Japan

B. India

C. Australia

D. France

---

2. The fastest human-made object has been clocked at up to 365,000 miles per hour. What was it?

A. A student fleeing campus for Christmas break

B. NASA's Parker Solar Probe

C. The Mars 2020 spacecraft

D. The Millennium Falcon

---

3. Hard sodas are coming to a store near you. What are these things?

A. Canned mead

B. Mulled wine

C. Malt beverages

D. Carbonated amari

---

4. Lithium prices have more than doubled this year. Why?

A. Lithuania was hit hard by Covid.

B. Russia has cut off most foreign buyers.

C. Demand for anti-depressants is soaring.

D. Electric cars need rechargeable batteries.

---

5. In response to inflation, Fed officials signaled at least how many possible rate hikes next year?

A. Zero

B. One

C. Two

D. Three

---

6. Stephen Gardner was named CEO -- of which mobile enterprise?

A. Amtrak

B. Delta Airlines

C. Greyhound

D. Verizon

---

7. Pfizer hailed its new antiviral pill as "a real home run" against Covid. What's it called?

A. Dingerafil

B. Paxlovid

C. Bellumizab

D. Covoidicin

---

8. Which of the world's 40 most populous countries had the most Covid deaths per capita?

A. The U.S.

B. China

C. Nigeria

D. Brazil

---

9. Per a new book, how did most Americans take their tea through the early 1940s?

A. Green with milk and sugar

B. Orange pekoe sweetened with preserves

C. Assam with a piece of honeycomb

D. Spiked with rye

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. B

3. C

4. D

5. D

6. A

7. B

8. D

9. A
